label: Behavior 49544898
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: following a curved maritime route (the persistent small differences between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and gradual course evolution, suggest the vessel is navigating a predefined curved channel or coastal bend; position progression follows an approximately linear trajectory in geographic coordinates with slight northeasterly curvature, modeled by a second-order polynomial: latitude ≈ 54.471 + 0.00016 × (longitude − 10.285)^2, where longitude ∈ [10.285, 10.300])
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a nearly constant speed between 7.7 and 10.1 knots with minimal fluctuation)
Course change: gradual and consistent (COG increases slowly and consistently from 36.3° to 51.4°, indicating a smooth turn to the right)
Heading fluctuation: stable (heading varies only slightly between 33.0° and 51.0°, remaining closely aligned with COG)

Behavior intent: following a curved maritime route (the persistent small differences between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and gradual course evolution, suggest the vessel is navigating a predefined curved channel or coastal bend; position progression follows an approximately linear trajectory in geographic coordinates with slight northeasterly curvature, modeled by a second-order polynomial: latitude ≈ 54.471 + 0.00016 × (longitude − 10.285)^2, where longitude ∈ [10.285, 10.300])
